captions.text:
00:06
COMM: This wildlife photographer got a little
more than he bargained for, on a trip to Botswana.

00:11
WILL: So I'm in the Makgadikgadi region of

Botswana, and I've come here to photograph
one of my favourite little creatures, meerkats.

00:20
COMM: Will Burrard - Lucas spent six days

photographing this meerkat family, and their
inquisitive new editions.

00:30
COMM: Attracted to Will's camera, the babies
were fascinated with their new toy.

00:37
COMM: As the kids played, a protective parents

took on the roll of sentry, instinctively
using Will as a makeshift lookout post, scanning

00:46
WILL: Now when you're the size of a meerkat

in Africa, you'll find a lot of things want
to eat you, so you always have to remain very

vigilant, however if you only stand a foot
off the ground it can sometimes be hard to

see over the long grass, so these enterprising
meerkats have discovered that humans make

01:05
COMM: Watching over newborns may be a tiring

task, but this sentry still found time for
some playful snaps.

title: Cute Meerkats Use Photographer As A Lookout Post
